nodes.bodyText: There's missing the @deprecated in both javadoc and method, if you don't want it in the backport you can remove this kind of line. Note that we're ok to backport deprecation such as them.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -588,6 +588,8 @@ void grantPermissionToTaskDelegatedActors(CoreSession session, String permission
      * @param session
      * @return
      * @since 7.2
+     * since 11.1 this method does not scale as it does not paginate results.

nodes.bodyText:
We tried to avoid that in order to have warnings on IDE since it is not deprecated for this version.
Does this sound a good approach?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -588,6 +588,8 @@ void grantPermissionToTaskDelegatedActors(CoreSession session, String permission
      * @param session
      * @return
      * @since 7.2
+     * since 11.1 this method does not scale as it does not paginate results.

nodes.bodyText:
So, as per our conversation, we kept the cherry-pick commit.
In order to be clear the difference on 10.10, a separate commit was introduced.
